zone.line: When over us, in blue expanse lost,
Its wavering song the lark sings
When over the rough pine tops
The eagle outspread floats
And over plains, over sees
The crane to her home stretches.
Wagner
I have myself often strange hours,
Yet such impulse have I never yet felt
One sees oneself light to wood & field enough
The birds wing will I not envy.
As others carry us the minds joy
From book to book from leaf to leaf
Then will winter nights be kind & beautiful
A happy life warms all the limbs,
And ah, ?trottest thou enough a worthy parchment
So ascends the whole heaven to thee near
Faust.
Thou art to thee now of an impulse known
O, learn not others knowledge!
Two souls dwell, alas! in my ?breast
